name: Aerin

appearance.description: Weather-browned woman with wind-tangled black hair usually braided with thin bone beads, steady river-grey eyes, and the posture of someone who grew up on swaying decks and ropeways. She wears pale bone-ceramic pauldrons over a storm-blue tabard marked with the Breathkeepers' spiral, and sturdy cliff boots fitted for grating and chain.
appearance.distinctive_signs: Crescent birthmark behind the left ear; faint scar across the bridge of the nose from a razorkite strike; carries a cold-glow moonshard lantern that hums softly when the wind organs sing.

history: Born in the Undershadows to a lamplighter clan, Aerin Rell grew up listening to the bones of Vaelor sing through the decks. As a Scale-born, she could hear tones others missed, and the Breathkeepers marked her early as a ward during gale season. When a floodrise nearly tore Riverfoot free, she broke the taboo against tolling horn in clear weather to summon crews and saved a dozen children; instead of punishment, High Cantor Ysil Aer guided her to swear a variant of the Hollow Oath as a paladin of the Unbroken Breath, binding her life to the safety of Ribcrown and the sanctity of Vaelor's remains. She trained on the Gale Organ Cliffs, learned the wind-rites, and served as mediator between dockers, riggers, and market scribes. When the Chainhouse Triad suffered fatal cable scoring, Aerin rode a platform during a night patrol and discovered saboteur marks shaped like moth wings under a catwalk. Refusing a rush to scapegoat the Moth Lanterns, she pulled the emergency clutch to drop an unmanned platform, sacrificing a shipment and her standing with the Rafter Guild but saving the system from catastrophic failure. Her brother, Jarik Rell of the Vigil, pressed her to name the culprits; Aerin held her tongue, believing there was a deeper hand behind the marks. Since then she has brokered quiet truces on the Crown-Market, ferried storm-warnings upriver, and taken on a ghost-barge debt to protect Scale-born gutter kids hidden by the Lanterns. She walks the ribs as living oath and shield while the Triune Charter strains, seeking the true note beneath the noise.

equipment.name: Oathplate Shield
equipment.description: Bone-ceramic shield etched with wind-tone grooves that vibrate under gale pressure and deflect falling debris; inlaid with a small oathstone that warms near false testimony.

equipment.name: Chainhook Glaive
equipment.description: A polearm favored by riggers and wardens with a recurved hook for catching cables and a weighted butt for bracing on swaying decks.

equipment.name: Moonshard Lantern
equipment.description: Cold-light lantern whose lens can replay starfields recorded on the Moonshard Heath; doubles as a signal to river pilots when shaded to specific tones.

equipment.name: Sporemask of the Ossuary
equipment.description: Fungal silk respirator treated with antibiotic shelf fungus, fitted with a bone ring stamped by the Vigil for lawful passage during Sporefall.

equipment.name: Breathkeeper Rite-Striker
equipment.description: Hand chime and striker used to call and count wind notes during patrols; illegal to sound outside ritual, though Aerin once did to save lives.

equipment.name: Rigger’s Line and Grip
equipment.description: Coil of waxed cord and an obsidian-toothed clamp for emergency traverses beneath decks and along lattice crawls.

relationships.Thia Mol: An uneasy ally and confidant; Aerin shielded the Lantern-Queen from a false charge after the Chainhouse deaths and secretly owes her a ghost-barge favor tied to protecting Scale-born children.
relationships.Jarik Rell: Older brother and Vigil warden; respects Aerin’s courage but distrusts her secrecy about the saboteurs. Their love is strong, their arguments sharper.
relationships.Gor Relk: Chainmaster who blames Aerin for dropping the emergency platform and costing the Guild prestige. He grudgingly respects her skill on the cables but believes she shields criminals.

ambitions: Uncover the true architects behind the Chainhouse sabotage, restore trust between the Rafter Guild and the Moth Lanterns, and codify a paladin’s charter that binds all three arms of the Triune to a shared safety oath without breaking the Hollow Oath.
flaws: Compulsively takes responsibility even when not hers; keeps dangerous secrets in the name of mercy; slow to forgive those who endanger bystanders; harbors bias against the River Lords after years of hard tolls on the poor.
dreams: To hear Vaelor’s final true chord and learn how to keep Ribcrown from ever falling; to see the Seat of the Hollow honored without being seized for power; to build a safe training deck for Scale-born youths under the Galecliffs.
secrets: Aerin used a forbidden memory-graft in the Marrow Archive to learn Chainhouse emergency procedures in a single night, and in payment she lost a treasured childhood song. She also accepted silver from a ghost-barge to erase a debt owed by the Moth Lanterns, and fears she forgot a vital promise she once made to Jarik about naming any saboteur she found.
